item.description:

item.title: Report E-2024030084
item.description:
Report E-2024030084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: JOLIET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When trailer was cleaned the tankwash missed putting a gasket in the discharge cap. Ecolab loaded the trailer and there was some product between the internal and external valves. The external valve wasn't tightened down well enough allowing product to get to the discharge cap. The discharge cap was missing the gasket inside which allowed the product to leak out on the ground. A response team was called in for clean up.

item.title: Report X-2024021903
item.description:
Report X-2024021903

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4678718 at the ramp facility in Chicago, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of 58 plastic jerricans, one of which showed evidence of spillage. Further investigation revealed that the jerrican in question had a loose closure, confirming spillage. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2024021884
item.description:
Report X-2024021884

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE AUTOMATED ROLLERS. LOADER DIDN'T THOUCH THE PACKAGE, LEFT THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR. SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND A DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO THE LOCATION. DESIGNATED RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKER PROPERLY WHILE HAVING FULL ON EQUIPMENT AND THE NECESSARY SUPPLIES.

item.title: Report X-2024021849
item.description:
Report X-2024021849

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and torn open from leaking contents. Package was placed into a haz bag and tote. Tote was taken to a QA area. DescribePack: 1 lead acid battery was leaking from top seams. Box had deflated air bags and insufficient packing material resulting in battery moving around inside box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Battery was adjusted to prevent further leakage and placed into a second haz bag.

item.title: Report X-2024021313
item.description:
Report X-2024021313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-17
  • City: KIRKLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the MDTR facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained four 1 gallon metal jerrycans each jerrycan was inside of a plastic bag. One of the jerrycans was damaged on the bottom chime causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. Shipper was contacted for a new declaration but requested that the shipment be destroyed.

item.title: Report E-2024030000
item.description:
Report E-2024030000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 23, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3266 had a faulty valve and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indian Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums. Crews transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into a new one 275-gallon tote. Crews cut up the damaged tote and placed the contents into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020597
item.description:
Report E-2024020597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 23, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon drums of paint fell off of a skid and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drum which were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020599
item.description:
Report E-2024020599

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately two gallons of alcohol were released from one 5-gallon poly pail. The release impacted the concrete dock.
